TunnelBox is a Hardware Gateway To Expose Your Local Servers & AI Models Publicly A dedicated hardware gateway that bridges your private network to the public internet making it effortless to expose development servers, staging environments, and AI inference endpoints securely.
View On Kickstarter
Images include AI-generated renders derived from real 3D mockups*
Why a hardware solution?

Developers should focus on what they love: building. A hardware ingress removes the complexity of network configurations like NAT and firewall rules, while providing an additional security layer before traffic reaches your application.

Made To Be Secure, Used Reliably

Tunnelbox is a single-purpose device designed to handle tunneling, securely and reliably.

Unlike CLI tools or VPNs, Tunnelbox doesn’t depend on your laptop staying awake, logged in, or correctly configured.

  • Outbound-only connections
The features that make tunneling simplier

Tunnelbox offers an array of services in connecting your services to the world.

Zero Network Configuration

Tunnelbox works anywhere by creating outbound-only secure tunnels.

Automatic SSL / TLS

Every domain comes with HTTPS out of the box. Certificates are issued and renewed automatically.

Free Managed Domains

Create multiple public domains per device.

Built for Developers

Designed for developers shipping fast. Expose localhost for webhooks, share live demos, deploy staging environments, or publish AI inference endpoints in seconds.

One Box To Connect Multiple Services

Expose multiple local services from a single device. Route traffic to different ports, containers, or services without additional hardware

Plug & Play

Plug it into power and your router, complete a quick setup, and you’re live. No additional configurations.

Regular Updates

A Security patches, firmware upgrades, and new features are delivered keeping your gateway secure and optimized.

One Year of Free Subscription

Every device includes one year of TunnelBox service — including managed domains, SSL, and updates.

End-to-End Encryption

All traffic is encrypted between TunnelBox and end user.

Easily Control Where Your Traffic Goes

Expose local LLMs, inference servers, or edge AI systems as production-ready HTTPS endpoints.
